title: Pep Guardiola eying reunion with Dani Alves? Transfer news and gossip from Saturday's papers
text:
Pep Guardiola eying reunion with Dani Alves? Transfer news and gossip from Saturday's papers PLUS: Arsenal are keeping tabs on a Spanish international and are considering a summer move Share Alves is reportedly wanted by Manchester City (Photo: Getty Images) Share Get football     
Manchester City are reportedly hoping to lure Dani Alves to the Etihad Stadium. 
The Juventus full-back is said to be on Pep Guardiola's summer wishlist but there are concerns about his wage demands, report The Sun. 
Guardiola managed Alves for four years at Barcelona and the Brazilian is allegedly keen to play in the Premier League before he retires. 
City were said to be close to signing Alves, 33, in January before injury got in the way of the deal. 
But they could return for his signature if his wage demands are lowered. Alves celebrates a goal for Juventus (Photo: REUTERS) Stories from other newspapers and websites 
Monaco hotshot Kylian Mbappe is wanted by Barcelona, Real Madrid, Manchester City, Arsenal and Borussia Dortmund. (Mundo Deportivo) 
Arsenal are monitoring Malaga midfielder Pablo Fornals. (Marca) Mbappe is in high demand (Photo: Getty Images) Stories from Saturday's Daily Mirror
